comment.author: 8487100@N07
comment._content: If this is 5x4 inches, does that mean it is a contact print? Interesting shot from a large format camera, if so...

comment.author: 31846825@N04
comment._content:
Thank you for your question, monkeyfinger. According to the photo archivist for the State Archives of Florida, when the prints of that time period (1940s) came to the Archives from the Department of Commerce they were mounted on a card with information about each photo. The original negatives were 4x5, and the contact print was made directly from the negative.  

Hope that helps.
comment.authorname: State Library and Archives of Florida

comment.author: 8487100@N07
comment._content: Thank you for your answer. I suppose most press cameras from that era were still 5x4. This is a wonderful image.
